title: 112_hr1834
content: The "Freedom to Invest Act of 2011" allows for a temporary dividends received deduction in 2011 or 2012. The taxpayer can elect to apply section 965 of the Internal Revenue Code to their last taxable year before the enactment date or their first taxable year within a 1-year period after the enactment. The election must be made before the due date for filing the tax return. The amount of dividends considered under subsection (a) cannot exceed the current and accumulated earnings and profits. The taxpayer can elect to apply section 965 of the Internal Revenue Code to their last taxable year before the enactment date or their first taxable year within a 1-year period after the enactment. The election must be made before the due date for filing the tax return. The amount of dividends considered under subsection (a) cannot exceed the current and accumulated earnings and profits described in section 959(c)(3) for the year a deduction is claimed under subsection (a), without diminution by reason of any distributions made during the election year, for all controlled foreign corporations of the United States shareholder. If the taxpayer's average employment level falls below the prior average, an additional amount equal to $25,000 multiplied by the number of employees by which the average falls below will be included in the taxpayer's income. The average employment level is determined by the average number of full-time US employees. The taxpayer's prior average employment is the average number of full-time US employees in the 24 months before receiving a distribution. A full-time US employee is defined as an individual providing services in the United States. A full-time US employee is defined as an individual providing services in the United States as a full-time employee, based on the employer's standards and practices. An exception is made for employees with a normal schedule of 40 hours or more per week. The text discusses amendments to the tax code regarding average employment levels, controlled group aggregation rules, and threshold periods. The changes include updating the date from June 30, 2003, to June 30, 2010. Amendments to the tax code include changes to base period, indebtedness determination date, and conforming amendments related to controlled groups. The amendments update dates and paragraphs in the tax code. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years ending on or after the date of the enactment of this Act for controlled groups filing a consolidated return.
